Author: adabsolutions
Title: [ANN][NEW!!!] ADAB - First Islamic Crypto Exchange, based on the Shariah norms
Body: Dear Adab Solutions community! Token sale of Adab is complete and we want to summarize its results. We view positively the completed token sale and continue working on the project with a great enthusiasm. We were not able to achieve our sales targets, but there were objective reasons for this and our results were significantly better than could be expected in the current market situation. During the time of token sale, we sold 45.5 million tokens and another 13.6 million issued as a bonuses. Additionally, we have accrued about 2 million tokens for the services rendered. Thus, the total emission amounted to 61.1 million tokens. In April and May of this year, Adab Solutions Company and affiliated Adab Solutions Group conducted the IEO on 4 exchanges. The ADAB Token will not be traded on the IDAX exchange due to the incompatibility of the IDAX exchange requirements with the principles of Islamic finance. All IEO members, who already invested in ADAB token on this exchange, will receive back their investment. About 5 mln Adab tokens were sold on the BitForex exchange and about 5 mln Adab tokens on the Bit-M and Bit-Z exchanges. Despite the low level of sales of tokens on these exchanges, the process of selling tokens was as transparent and fair as possible. We absolutely do not associate this level of sales of tokens during the crowdsale and IEO with a fair assessment of the project. There are a number of objective reasons, as the state of the market and the possibilities of the platforms on which IEO was conducted, which were overestimated by us, but our assessment was based on publicly available information and the course of negotiations with the exchanges. The company believes that the real value of the project is immeasurably higher and our performance should prove this in the near future. Summarizing the above, the total volume of Adab tokens issued on the crowdsale was 71.1 million units.

Author: adabsolutions
Title: [ANN][NEW!!!] ADAB - First Islamic Crypto Exchange, based on the Shariah norms
Body: Muslims ‚Äì represent the big number of  developing countries with a great potential for economic growth and the richest countries in the world, such as, the United Arab Emirates, Saudi Arabia, Kuwait, Brunei, Bahrain, Turkey, Oman, Malaysia and other countries.  The majority of over 1.8 billion Muslims have serious Shariah restrictions that regulate their lives, including all aspects of financial relations.  Islamic banks and financial organizations  is the fastest growing sector of the global  finance. With more than 3 trillion dollars capitalization and annual growth rate of 12%.   Cryptocurrencies market in this sector is underdeveloped due to ambiguous attitudes towards them in some Muslim countries and an obvious ban because of religious reasons. However, the situation is changing rapidly and more interest has been shown.  For a better and faster development of this market, it is necessary for exchanges to operate in accordance with the principles of Islamic finance. Existing exchanges getting certificates of Shariah compliance, but they do not deal with cryptocurrency issues from the Islamic finance point of view.   First Islamic crypto exchange - (FICE) is the only crypto-exchange in the world that has its own Sharia Advisory Board consisting of prominent Islamic leaders, who monitor the compliance of exchange operations with the principles of Islamic finance. This builds a trust to the project in an Islamic environment all around the world.   FICE Exchange is not just complied with the rules of Islamic finance, it also actively promotes cryptocurrency, creates the ecosystem necessary for Muslims - the relevant information portal (ADABCRYPTO), a charitable foundation (ADAB CHARITY), Donate money to charity and creates a platform for launching Halal (corresponding to Islamic finance) cryptocurrency projects (ADAB PROJECT).   FICE develops new markets for cryptocurrencies, involves new users regardless of religion and views, thereby giving a rise to cryptocurrency capitalization, which is very important for ICO participants, providing an opportunity to make good money on perspective project.  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=N785gQYa9eU

Author: Furious 7
Title: [ANN][NEW!!!] ADAB - First Islamic Crypto Exchange, based on the Shariah norms
Body: I am among those who are still doubtful about the law of trading. In my opinion tarading is like gambling and full of speculation. Trade in Islam requires an agreement between the seller and the buyer and both do not feel disadvantaged. how does adab provide a solution about this?

Author: adabsolutions
Title: [ANN][NEW!!!] ADAB - First Islamic Crypto Exchange, based on the Shariah norms
Body: Ibn Taymiyyah states that there is no authentic evidence in the Shariah that requires the prohibition of every risk; in fact, it is known that Allah Almighty and His Messenger did not prohibit every risk nor everything of uncertain gain or loss or delivery. There is no authentic Shariah evidence that requires the prohibition of all these types; neither a text nor an analogy. What is prohibited of these types is that which involves acquiring the property of others illegitimately. The Shariah‚Äôs reason for prohibiting [a transaction] is the illegitimate acquisition of others‚Äô property, and it is prohibited to acquire others‚Äô property illegitimately even in the absence of risk.  Risk, in and of itself, is not prohibited. In fact, the presence of risk is a fundamental element to profit from a venture. The Islamic legal maxims state: ‚Äú[The right to] profit [from something] goes with responsibility [for   it]‚Äù. Another maxim states: ‚ÄúLiability is an obligation accompanying gain‚Äù (al-Kasani, 1986)   Investing in high risk investments such as shares in a Shariah compliant start-up company cannot be deemed impermissible even though there is exposure to high risk. The volatility of such an investment will not impact the inherent compliance of the assets and transaction. Undeniably, trading, investments and gambling are all regarded as speculative risks. However, there are clear differences between gambling, trade and investments which highlight the difference in risk. Trading and investing are positive-sum games whilst gambling is a zero-sum game. Positive-sum games are where the parties gain together or lose together. In a partnership, partners mutually gain or mutually lose if the venture fails. In zero-sum games, one party gains at the expense of another. Considering cryptocurrency transactions, cryptocurrencies are  exchanged for a counter-exchange where both parties anticipate gain from their acquired asset. It is never guaranteed that one party will surely lose. Thus, such transactions are positive-sum games as both transacting parties anticipate gain. Therefore, cryptocurrency exchanges cannot be likened to Maysir and Qimar (gambling) due to the inherent difference between positive-sum and zero-sum games.

Author: adabsolutions
Title: [ANN][NEW!!!] ADAB - First Islamic Crypto Exchange, based on the Shariah norms
Body: Our model of token economics: a limited number of tokens are emitted which are payment instruments in the Adab and FICE ecosystem, then every month 10% of the company's profits are sent to buy tokens, and they are burned, that is, destroyed. Thus, the number of users gradually increases, the turnover and the need for tokens increase, and their number is reduced. There is a deflation of the token, that is, its value increases. To prevent the token from falling, the company will buy it out at market value, but not lower than the nominal price of $ 0.1.

Author: adabsolutions
Title: [ANN][NEW!!!] ADAB - First Islamic Crypto Exchange, based on the Shariah norms
Body: ADAB Soutions, this is a rare project, as this is the world's first cryptocurrency exchange operating in accordance with the principles of Islamic Finance and opens the possibility for the crypto market to gain access to the Islamic world. Our mission is to give an opportunity for each and every human being in the world to experience all the pros of dealing with the cryptocurrencies. We want people to see that, cryptocurrencies can be safe, honest and reliable. ADAB Solutions` business operations are Sharia compliant, meaning that we can guarantee the ethical and appropriate ways of doing business. ADAB Solutions cannot accept investments from or financially transact with someone whose wealth is completely, or predominantly, haram. Where there is a problem is when the funds received from the ICO are from criminal or immoral proceeds regardless of which religion the investor is, or the lack of investigating where source of the funds was from. If it is predominantly halal, then financial transaction, borrowing, accepting gifts, etc. would be permissible. If one is unsure, then the default assumption is that most of their wealth is lawful. ADAB Solutions doing KYC and AML on their investors and cannot investigate deep into the wealth of investor, but rather the basis is what is apparent. Adab Team cannot check the "moral standing of each investor‚Äù. If the Majority of the profit the company makes is from a halal activity and you are not directly involved in the smaller haram aspect of it, then you ought to assume that your income is from the halal, and you won't be culpable. If you find out that part of received money from haram sources best to give it to charity because you can't do anything else with it. But you shouldn‚Äôt expect any reward for giving it to charity. and Allah ta'ala knows best.  Best regards, Maxat Salpyn, Deputy-CEO on Islamic finance, ADAB Solutions

Author: adabsolutions
Title: [ANN][NEW!!!] ADAB - First Islamic Crypto Exchange, based on the Shariah norms
Body: Quote from: LoveCryptoAll on February 11, 2019, 08:10:27 PM You write . "ADAB Soutions, this is a rare project, as it is the world's first cryptocurrency exchange, operating in accordance with the principles of Islamic finance." I really want to know how the principles of Islamic finance differ from general principles of financing. I always thought that finances for religion are irrelevant.  Islam is more than a religion; it‚Äôs also a code of life that deals with social, economic, and political matters. Islamic finance, then, is a financial system that operates according to Sharia. Just like conventional financial systems, Islamic finance features banks, capital markets, fund managers, investment firms, and insurance companies. Islamic finance is based on real business deals and real economic activities that bear risk and are open to acquire profits while conventional banks are based on Riba (interest) lending and borrowing activities which avoid risk and thus promote social injustice and later leads to economic crises and depressions. The main difference between Islamic and conventional finance is the treatment of risk, and how risk is shared. Islamic finance requires that finance is provided on the principle of profit and loss sharing.   Quote from: dnsokoljuk on February 12, 2019, 12:07:17 PM I heared many good words about ADAB. Why so small ammount of posts in this thread?  This is the new thread;)   Quote from: SergeyZ on February 17, 2019, 08:42:39 PM When will you start a smart contract? Already know the exact date?  After the end of Private Sale.   Quote from: BoxerRobert on February 17, 2019, 12:05:07 PM This team is really great their charity concept also looking very interested .I like this project all the best team . Quote from: canaveralnonie on February 12, 2019, 11:36:59 PM Most of my friends recommend this Adab Solution for it's activeness with different activities, system/project update and seminars. Specially when I visited their official telegram with 34,295 members. Kindly check the linked here ( https://t.me/Adabsolutions ). Quote from: dnsokoljuk on February 12, 2019, 12:07:17 PM I heared many good words about ADAB. Why so small ammount of posts in this thread?  Thank you for support, guys!
